sourceMeaningMnemonic: Even though you’ve <radical>old</radical> <radical>legs</radical>, you <kanji>overcome</kanji> your disability. These old legs of yours don’t work very well, but you overcome the odds and you run a marathon!
meaningInfo: Imagine running a marathon with your old legs to prove you can overcome anything. Feel your old legs cramping up as you try to overcome the marathon and finish the race.
readingMnemonic: When you pass the finish line and finally <kanji>overcome</kanji> the limits of your old legs, someone hands you an ice cold <reading>Coke</reading> (<ja>こく</ja>) as a reward. Mmm, such a refreshing Coke.
readingInfo: Filled with the jubilation of achievement from overcoming all odds, imagine the flavor of this cold Coke in your mouth. Fizzy and Coke flavored, it runs down your throat and into your tummy. Yum.
